title: Potted Fig Tree Care: Water Sunlight Fertilizer Pot Size & MORE

subtasks: Ensure proper pot size (at least three gallons)
Provide adequate fertilizer (slow release, e.g., Florican, Osmocote)
Water regularly (e.g., half gallon per five gallons daily in warm weather)
Use well-draining soil mix (e.g., ProMix, compost, perlite, vermiculite)
Apply mulch to regulate soil temperature and moisture
Monitor and adjust for climate extremes (e.g., moving trees to avoid temperatures below 15°F)
Consider using automatic drip irrigation systems for consistent watering
Position containers in sunny areas with radiating heat for warmth
Root prune trees every 2-3 years to maintain health and productivity (if in smaller pots)
Use slow-release fertilizer at the beginning of the growing season
Follow recommended application rates on the product label
Tailor watering frequency based on soil size, temperature, and tree size
Ensure consistent moisture balance to prevent root rot
Choose an appropriate potting mix
Add organic materials like bark, vermiculite, or rice hulls
Incorporate mycorrhizae for improved root health
Apply a layer of wood chips to retain moisture and moderate temperature

tasks.task: Position fig trees for optimal sun and warmth
subtasks: Place containers in areas with direct sunlight
Utilize heat-retaining methods like proximity to structures or hardscapes
Monitor tree growth and adjust pot size if necessary
Plan for winter protection in colder climates (e.g., moving pots to sheltered areas)
Regularly check for signs of nutrient deficiencies or pests.
